title: Overcoming Procrastination
subtitle: Stop avoiding, start doing
description: Procrastination isn't laziness—it's usually fear, perfectionism, or overwhelm in disguise. This course helps you understand why you procrastinate, work with the emotions driving avoidance, and build systems that make starting easier than avoiding.

modules.title: Why You Procrastinate
modules.description: It's not laziness—here's what it actually is

modules.title: Working with Resistance
modules.description: What to do when you don't want to start

modules.title: Making Starting Easy
modules.description: Environment, systems, and tiny first steps

whatYouLearn: Understand the real reasons behind procrastination
Work with the fears and perfectionism driving avoidance
requirements: Willingness to start before you feel ready

questions.question: What is procrastination usually NOT about?
How does perfectionism lead to procrastination?
options: If it can't be perfect, it feels safer not to start at all

questions.question: What's the key to working with resistance?
options: Acknowledge it, feel it, and take a tiny action anyway

questions.question: What makes starting easier?
options: Lowering the bar—tiny first steps, prepared environment, removing friction

questions.question: What's the difference between sustainable momentum and burnout?
options: Sustainable momentum includes rest, self-compassion, and realistic pacing
Burnout means you're working hard enough
